page.title: 15A SUMMER'S DAY IN RAMSGATE
page.content: Saturday July 20 1985 dawned bright and sunny.Light aircraft were flying over Ramsgate & landing at Manston Airport. The passengers got into cars and set off for Sandwich.In Ramsgate,many more were going in cars also heading for Sandwich,to watch the world's golfing greats in the British Open tournament. The clouds built up;it rained for a time & traffic eased.Towards noon, the traffic increased,this time heading for Manston airfield.Soon,every space along local roads & farm tracks was taken up by cars.At about 12.30,clouds & rain almost obscured the triangular shaped object descending from the sky.It was the famous Concorde,paying a special visit.During the afternoon,a storm halted the golf for a while.As evening approached,strange brown clouds appeared & engulfed the area in a very bad hailstorm.Typical summer weather!!!
